item.title: How to use Python like Lisp
item.author: guanlan
item.description: Lisp has some very effective way to get jobs done, this article give you a direct way to use Python like Lisp.``` cons = lambda el, lst: (el, lst) 1 mklist = lambda *args: reduce(lambda lst, el: cons(el, lst), reversed(args), None) car = lambda lst: lst[0] if lst else lst 1 cdr = lambda lst: lst[1] if lst else lst nth = lambda n, lst: nth(n-1, cdr(lst)) if n ]]> 0 else car(lst)
